Source code for tastypie.http

"""
The various HTTP responses for use in returning proper HTTP codes.
"""
from django.http import HttpResponse



[docs]class HttpCreated(HttpResponse):
    status_code = 201

    def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs):
        location = kwargs.pop('location', '')

        super(HttpCreated, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs)
        self['Location'] = location




[docs]class HttpAccepted(HttpResponse):
    status_code = 202




[docs]class HttpNoContent(HttpResponse):
    status_code = 204




[docs]class HttpMultipleChoices(HttpResponse):
    status_code = 300




[docs]class HttpSeeOther(HttpResponse):
    status_code = 303




[docs]class HttpNotModified(HttpResponse):
    status_code = 304




[docs]class HttpBadRequest(HttpResponse):
    status_code = 400




[docs]class HttpUnauthorized(HttpResponse):
    status_code = 401




[docs]class HttpForbidden(HttpResponse):
    status_code = 403




[docs]class HttpNotFound(HttpResponse):
    status_code = 404




[docs]class HttpMethodNotAllowed(HttpResponse):
    status_code = 405




[docs]class HttpConflict(HttpResponse):
    status_code = 409




[docs]class HttpGone(HttpResponse):
    status_code = 410




[docs]class HttpTooManyRequests(HttpResponse):
    status_code = 429




[docs]class HttpApplicationError(HttpResponse):
    status_code = 500




[docs]class HttpNotImplemented(HttpResponse):
    status_code = 501
